page.title: 04Farming in Dilhorne
page.content: Dilhorne is a predominatly farming community made up of family sized farms employing only one or two workers other than the family. Dairy farming and the raising of cattle is the major concern. There is no cereal grown but the roaming and undulating landscape provides pasture for the cattle and silage for winter feed.Some farms specialise in rearing calves till they are fully grown and then sell them whilest others will buy them fully grown.A few keep hens and one farm actually factory farms hens for the sale of the eggs to the local market.Another side line is that of sheep rearing for the wool. Most of the farms in Dilhorne are very old and this is reflected in the age of the farmhouses.The original estate belong to the manor but this was graduly sold off over the years.
